As an investor, the factors you can control are your risk, cost, the time at which you're investing & your behavior. The ones you can’t control is how the market is going to do & your returns.Hold tight: Even if there’s a drop in the market now, it'll always go up in the long run pic.twitter.com/xBEwRFtRYZ

Passive investing is the way to go! Instead of trying to game the market by rushing to buy trending assets & selling them in a panic when prices start to drop, a passive investor stays calm & leaves the assets to grow over time. Learn more on our blog: http:// ow.ly/lKSs30jnqds

The Wall Street Journal tested to see if stock picking really works. They did this by giving a monkey darts to throw at a list of stocks where he ended up beating the experts. Don't stock pick, diversify! You can check out the article here: http:// ow.ly/TKt330jkk9E #invest pic.twitter.com/P7pgO3FV60

Rule 2 of investing: Diversify! Diversification is basically the concept of not putting all your eggs in one basket. Instead, spread your money out across many different investment instruments & companies. By diversifying, you are decreasing your risk and maximizing your return! pic.twitter.com/5Vha9NZIiP
